headline.main: What We Think About When We Think About the Court

docs.abstract: For most justices, most of the time, the relationship between ideology and outcome is oblique.
docs.snippet: For most justices, most of the time, the relationship between ideology and outcome is oblique.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wherever I go these days, someone is bound to ask me how I think the Supreme Court will rule in the challenge to the Affordable Care Act, set for argument over three days during the last week in March. My response, that I expect the court to uphold the law, predictably evokes an expression of disbelief verging on pity for my display of such naïveté. "Won't the justices just vote their politics?" my questioner invariably asks.

headline.main: What We Think About When We Think About the Court

docs.abstract: For most justices, most of the time, the relationship between ideology and outcome is oblique.
docs.snippet: For most justices, most of the time, the relationship between ideology and outcome is oblique.

headline.main: Montefiore Nurses May Strike on Jan. 10

docs.abstract: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center say more nurses are needed to alleviate demands placed on them, but the hospital says it faces financial challenges.
docs.snippet: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center say more nurses are needed to alleviate demands placed on them, but the hospital says it faces financial challenges.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an unexpected move, nurses at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx said Wednesday that they would strike on Jan. 10 if they could not resolve issues involving staffing levels and salaries.

headline.main: Montefiore Nurses May Strike on Jan. 10

docs.abstract: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center say more nurses are needed to alleviate demands placed on them, but the hospital says it faces financial challenges.
docs.snippet: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center say more nurses are needed to alleviate demands placed on them, but the hospital says it faces financial challenges.

docs.abstract: This year, some of the best small-business bloggers in the business took us inside their companies and showed us what life is really like in the trenches.
docs.snippet: This year, some of the best small-business bloggers in the business took us inside their companies and showed us what life is really like in the trenches.

docs.lead_paragraph: Here at You're the Boss, we believe that most small-business owners are really good at a few things, the things that allowed them to get their businesses off the ground. Inevitably, however, most owners are unprepared for the dozens of other tasks that are essential to running a business. We hope to help with those. But we don't try to make it look easy.
docs.abstract: This year, some of the best small-business bloggers in the business took us inside their companies and showed us what life is really like in the trenches.
docs.snippet: This year, some of the best small-business bloggers in the business took us inside their companies and showed us what life is really like in the trenches.

headline.main: The Biggest Cut in Unemployment Benefits

docs.abstract: The federal stimulus, now expired, brought with it substantial benefits for the unemployed that have also now expired, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The federal stimulus, now expired, brought with it substantial benefits for the unemployed that have also now expired, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

docs.lead_paragraph: The widespread failure of all-metal hips may cost taxpayers, insurers and employers billions of dollars in the coming years.

headline.seo: The High Cost of Failing Artificial Hips
headline.main: The High Cost of Failing Artificial Hips
headline.print_headline: Common Failure Of Hip Implants Brings Big Costs

docs.abstract: Medical and legal experts estimate that the widespread failure of all-metal artificial hip implants may cost taxpayers, insurers and employers billion of dollars in the coming years, contributing to the soaring cost of health care; the financial fallout is expected to be unusually large and complex because the episode involves a class of products, not a single device or company.
docs.snippet: The widespread failure of all-metal hips may cost taxpayers, insurers and employers billions of dollars in the coming years.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an Op-Ed essay about the difficulty of finding hospice facilities for some patients.

headline.main: Finding Hospice Care for the Dying
headline.print_headline: Finding Hospice Care for the Dying

docs.abstract: Letter by David C Leven, executive director of Compassion and Choices of New York, responds to December 22 Op-Ed article by Theresa Brown about the difficulty of finding hospice facilities for some patients.
